items.title: Lazy twitter question: is there any way to make the compiler to auto-vectorize this piece of code? It does bit shuffling, and I believe it can be compiled to an SSSE3's pshufb instruction.
items.content_html:
é«˜æ¢¨é™£å¹³@jingbay

Rui Ueyama@rui314 Lazy twitter question: is there any way to make the compiler to auto-vectorize this piece of code? It does bit shuffling, and I believe it can be compiled to an SSSE3's pshufb instruction.

Compiler Explorer - C++ (x86-64 gcc 12.1)

static uint32_t bit(uint32_t val, int pos) { return (val >> pos) & 1; }; uint32_t cjtype(uint32_t val) { return bit(val, 11) << 12 | bit(val, 4) << 11 | bit(val, 9) << 10 | bit(val, 8) << 9 | bit(val, 10) << 8 | bit(val, 6) << 7 | bit(val, 7) << 6 | bit(val, 3) << 5 | bit(val, 2) << 4 | bit(val, 1) << 3 | bit(val, 5) << 2; }

Article URL: https://godbolt.org/z/EGKbTf7Mb
